(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-03-15 21:55:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-03-16 01:05:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

the db modification looks good (except Ihar comment).

But AgentAvailabilityZoneMixin.create_or_update_agent always set timestamp. create_or_update_agent method needs to be updated to allow no-timestamp case.
Otherwise there is no way for ml2 mech driver to create row entry in agentdb with timestamp=null.

maybe it can be done with following patches. If that's the plan, I would +1.

Probably we'd like to add state column to agent_db."}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-03-16 10:08:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

Thank you Ihar and Isaku for your review.'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2018-03-28 09:28:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Thanks Isaku, nice finding.

Do we have mix of agents supporting health check and not supporting enabled in a setup? If not, then we can enable health check [1][2] only if required.

We are doing arithmetic operations[3] and comparisons[4] on heartbeat_timestamp which will give TypeError if it is None.

How about returning current time(for agents which doesn't provide heartbeat) in modify_fields_from_db()[5] when code access agent_obj.Agent i.e below code in [5]. As we are returning current time stamp, this agent will always be alive and won't see errors if code is trying to do arithmetic operations or comparisons.

def modify_fields_from_db(cls, db_obj):
   ...
   ...
   if not result['heartbeat_timestamp']:
       result['heartbeat_timestamp'] = timeutils.utcnow()    
   return fields

[1] 
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py#L200
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/agents_db.py#L296
[3] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/agents_db.py#L298
[4] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/agents_db.py#L151
[5] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/objects/agent.py#L71"}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-03-28 10:28:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

We need to support both. For example, after a migration from ML2/OVS to ML2/OVN the server may see both.'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-03-28 14:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Anil, your proposal of "modify_fields_from_db" sounds good to me. I will be away the next two days (local holiday). Feel free to take the patch here and add that, and what Isaku was commenting too.

Remember we may need to break this down in two patches (one that can be backported, one that not).'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2018-03-29 11:21:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2018-03-29 11:24:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

May be we need to document that "virtual agents need to add virtual_agent key to agent's configurations dict."

@Miguel, feel free to revert this patchset if you are not happy with this approach :) Thanks'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-04-02 12:44:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(3 comments)

Looks good. We still need to address Isaku's comments (allowing to create an agent with no timestamp). How would we solve that part? :)"}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2018-04-03 05:21:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2018-04-03 05:37:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

In this new approach we are not allowing agent creation without timestamp.

There are two ways to create a agent
2) networking-ovn can directly call plugin.create_or_update_agent[1] to create the virtual agent
1) Agents like dhcp, L3 and L2 can use report_state RPC [2] which eventually calls plugin.create_or_update_agent[3]

Internally create_or_update_agent will use current time for heartbeat_timestamp[4]. This will address Iasaku's comments.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/agents_db.py#L307 
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/agents_db.py#L417
[3] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/agents_db.py#L436
[4] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/agents_db.py#L352"}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-04-03 08:50:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

Thanks for the explanation anil, that sounds perfectly fine, and we don't need to deal with DB / compatibility across versions / update issues.

Great solution IMHO.

Let's see what Isaku thinks."}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-04-03 08:50:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-04-03 09:04:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

We need to change the author of this one :D @Anil, it's yours now, mine is only the commit message :)"}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2018-04-03 10:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-04-04 20:39:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-04-05 10:39:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

I think that some release note about that could be added and docs should be maybe updated also. Maybe some info about this could be e.g. in https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/contributor/internals/services_and_agents.html - what do You think about that?'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-04-05 17:30:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: -Code-Review

I don't think a release note here is justified (nothing changes for neutron in-tree components). A release note in networking-ovn would make sense though.

Agreed it may be useful to capture the feature in devref."}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-04-10 15:26:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

+1 for updating doc.'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-09-04 14:28:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

We followed another approach from OVN https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578225/

ODL could do the same thing, or we could introduce an callback/API in neutron to gather agent information from mech drivers.'}]

commit_message:
Make agent heartbeat_timestamp reporting optional

On the Rocky PTG, one of the points was the ability of ml2
mechanism drivers to report virtual agents to list the L2 hosts
when such agents don't exist, or don't connect to the messaging
bus.

It was decided that not all agents were able, or were not interested
for scalability reasons in providing heartbeats, and that it should
be made optional.

These agents need to set virtual_agent key in their configurations
dict so that server can always list them as alive.

Change-Id: I5c3839a773d3f559d624c794591f829fbb633fc1

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I22e03209fa51db13b55d8cc685589603252f4b35
Story: #2002586
Task: #24319

commit_message:
Remove molteniron playbook mistakenly left behind

In https://review.openstack.org/587586 we removed everything
except the playbook. This closes that loop.

Change-Id: Iea81197e10d6e85b723b719ca704421a7f45d927
(cherry picked from commit 1c6e80974c9e25b7bc9e8e3e3116783bd84ed3e9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-03 12:20:52.000000000', 'message': "Use tripleo-admin user for minor updates

In Rocky we've moved to config-download, which also means ssh
administration via tripleo-admin user when running Ansible via
Mistral.

Using heat-admin no longer seems to work for freshly deployed Rocky
environments, we need tripleo-admin. For upgraded environments, the
assumption is that we'd create and authorize tripleo-admin user during
upgrade from Queens to Rocky, so using tripleo-admin for subsequent
minor update should be safe too.

Change-Id: If4f65d1001c23829fe3285493a6f18bc9af05a99
Closes-Bug: #1789220
(cherry picked from commit effb11b7e351eb9fc6d5762ae41ce5f6ed5ccd7f)
"}]
commit_message:
Use tripleo-admin user for minor updates

In Rocky we've moved to config-download, which also means ssh
administration via tripleo-admin user when running Ansible via
Mistral.

Using heat-admin no longer seems to work for freshly deployed Rocky
environments, we need tripleo-admin. For upgraded environments, the
assumption is that we'd create and authorize tripleo-admin user during
upgrade from Queens to Rocky, so using tripleo-admin for subsequent
minor update should be safe too.

Change-Id: If4f65d1001c23829fe3285493a6f18bc9af05a99
Closes-Bug: #1789220
(cherry picked from commit effb11b7e351eb9fc6d5762ae41ce5f6ed5ccd7f)

commit_message:
Add reflection of RpcPort to health checks

This patch passes RpcPort parameter value to container health check
scripts, which are based on verifying if service is connected to RabbitMQ.

Change-Id: If63f136b5173bb9a94572ea5062a188469c2c782
Closes-Bug: #1782369

commit_message:
Remove blacklisted entries from whitelist file

This version of stestr is not capable of handling both a whitelist and a
blacklist so we remove the blacklisted tests from the whitelist file and
only specify that.

Change-Id: Ic2ec15d51fb9ca0362c29701e40de20901604d96

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-03 10:37:48.000000000', 'message': "Add tempest test blacklist capability

While the whitelist may contain regex, sometimes using regex
is difficult and it is simpler just to blacklist the specific
test you're looking to block.

This patch adds the capability to specify a list of tests to
blacklist.

Change-Id: I16bd158ff8cd2e9b1ff42876dcf7796676f54b68
(cherry picked from commit 2cda0e178e6e6e172b10202880a302f2fad7f21f)
"}]
commit_message:
Add tempest test blacklist capability

While the whitelist may contain regex, sometimes using regex
is difficult and it is simpler just to blacklist the specific
test you're looking to block.

This patch adds the capability to specify a list of tests to
blacklist.

Change-Id: I16bd158ff8cd2e9b1ff42876dcf7796676f54b68
(cherry picked from commit 2cda0e178e6e6e172b10202880a302f2fad7f21f)

commit_message:
Increase delayed_calls_v2.auth_context

When the keystone catalog gets big, no execution can be made because the
catalog cannot fit in the `auth_context` field.

Change-Id: I100494e467f43386be17eb397fbdf0a0edd24453
Closes-Bug: 1785654

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ib40513ee8c27f0a6e3a5232b457bc80b74eeb3bd
Story: #2002586
Task: #24314

[{'created': '2018-08-31 22:24:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix queens fs016 fs019

In queens, the ceph-ansible workflow does not work with config download.
These jobs should not be using config-download.  This was improperly
converted as part of I881f92e6cef4de58a9731f03669e42bc862964ec. This is
a partial revert of that patch for featureset016 and featureset019.  The
featureset documentation indicates that these are not configured with
config download.

https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-quickstart/latest/feature-configuration.html

Change-Id: Ib6c3ca7886c5e4adb0883c501bfbb390e15d108f
Closes-Bug: #1790144
Related-Bug: #1789416
'}]
commit_message:
Fix queens fs016 fs019

In queens, the ceph-ansible workflow does not work with config download.
These jobs should not be using config-download.  This was improperly
converted as part of I881f92e6cef4de58a9731f03669e42bc862964ec. This is
a partial revert of that patch for featureset016 and featureset019.  The
featureset documentation indicates that these are not configured with
config download.

https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-quickstart/latest/feature-configuration.html

Change-Id: Ib6c3ca7886c5e4adb0883c501bfbb390e15d108f
Closes-Bug: #1790144
Related-Bug: #1789416

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I1a7a9442530af7cf8a2f1d4ccdf5df672c4e92fe
Story: #2002586
Task: #24289

commit_message:
Add openstack-map repository

The openstack-map repository will be used by Foundation staff as
source data to build the OpenStack map and the "Software"
section of the openstack.org website.

Placing it in gerrit will help OpenStack project teams propose
fixes to the data presented there.

Change-Id: Iecb5d238e946c3fa5fce0179bed41ff0df95e8b6

[{'created': '2018-09-03 16:01:40.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Ceph enabled jobs failing.

All jobs which have ceph services enabled
are failing in the workflow step which creates
the tripleo-admin user. The reason is because
the ceph-ansible workbook doesn't retrieve the
private_key before calling to enable_ssh_admin.
This patch modifies the order of the tasks.

Change-Id: I3a6278b6650cc1a4215ba8cb04aa1577ce957007
"}, {'created': '2018-09-04 08:55:48.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Ceph enabled jobs failing.

All jobs which have ceph services enabled
are failing in the workflow step which creates

Change-Id: I3a6278b6650cc1a4215ba8cb04aa1577ce957007
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Ceph enabled jobs failing.

All jobs which have ceph services enabled
are failing in the workflow step which creates
the tripleo-admin user. The reason is because
the ceph-ansible workbook doesn't retrieve the
private_key before calling to enable_ssh_admin.
This patch modifies the order of the tasks.

Change-Id: I3a6278b6650cc1a4215ba8cb04aa1577ce957007

commit_message:
Complete initialization of security_group_rule quota

Ensure the security_group_rule quota is initialized when
quota_details extension is not supported. Otherwise,
security_group_rule will not be initialized with 'used' and
'available' dictionary items.

commit_message:
Complete initialization of security_group_rule quota

Ensure the security_group_rule quota is initialized when
quota_details extension is not supported. Otherwise,
security_group_rule will not be initialized with 'used' and
'available' dictionary items.

Change-Id: If1e45af9d6ab0c7cbf431621c6b03d5ba2478ea0
Closes-Bug: #1788631

commit_message:
Update neutron import

neutron.agent.linux.async_process is now moving to the "common"
module.

While this will be a backwards compatible change, I'm updating all
three subprojects using this module, avoiding deprecation warnings.

Depends-On: #I6a7418cb8680cd71fe16c5d98b9b09ef2d260d37
Change-Id: I4486794cf04f1ebd08da906379a0f15e5452380a

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I361b908c4ae2cab8cbaf72f660a5df753605175f
Story: #2002586
Task: #24314

import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some

normalized.

messages: [{'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2018-09-04 01:08:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-09-04 03:07:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nworks around distro installs on CentOS 7'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-04 10:16:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-04 01:08:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix api-paste.ini path in RedHat ditro install

This patch aims to revert the commit meant to
fix api-paste.ini [1] that has no effect to
solve the path problem in distro installs based
on RedHat.

After the neutron_install.yml task responsible
to install neutron role packages, some config files
are placed in /usr/share/neutron, some of these files
are soft links from /etc/neutron from /usr/share/neutron.

One of the config files that is used by neutron-server is
the api-paste.ini that needs to be placed in /etc/neutron in
order to the service to initalize correctly.

This is a workaround only for RedHat distro installs
and the root cause is still being investigated.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/commit/c0b17e9d89d86d0f9543c401316727cfcd6045f2

Change-Id: Ie5441b8d2b147bf0e57928a2b6ea6a745a96c67f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix api-paste.ini path in RedHat ditro install

This patch aims to revert the commit meant to
fix api-paste.ini [1] that has no effect to
solve the path problem in distro installs based
on RedHat.

After the neutron_install.yml task responsible
to install neutron role packages, some config files
are placed in /usr/share/neutron, some of these files
are soft links from /etc/neutron from /usr/share/neutron.

One of the config files that is used by neutron-server is
the api-paste.ini that needs to be placed in /etc/neutron in
order to the service to initalize correctly.

This is a workaround only for RedHat distro installs
and the root cause is still being investigated.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/commit/c0b17e9d89d86d0f9543c401316727cfcd6045f2

Change-Id: Ie5441b8d2b147bf0e57928a2b6ea6a745a96c67f

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28487, 'date': '2018-06-28 22:01:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1 Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 28487, 'date': '2018-06-28 22:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

diff --git a/magnum/drivers/heat/k8s_coreos_template_def.py b/magnum/drivers/heat/k8s_coreos_template_def.py
index fdfb90b..28e73ee 100644
--- a/magnum/drivers/heat/k8s_coreos_template_def.py
+++ b/magnum/drivers/heat/k8s_coreos_template_def.py
@@ -10,10 +10,12 @@
 # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations
 # under the License.
 
+import base64
 from oslo_log import log as logging
 from oslo_utils import strutils
 
 from magnum.common.x509 import operations as x509
+from magnum.common import utils
 from magnum.conductor.handlers.common import cert_manager
 from magnum.drivers.heat import k8s_template_def
 from magnum.drivers.heat import template_def
@@ -109,6 +111,10 @@ class CoreOSK8sTemplateDefinition(k8s_template_def.K8sTemplateDefinition):
                 ca_cert.get_private_key(),
                 ca_cert.get_private_key_passphrase()).replace("\n", "\\n")
 
+        plain_openstack_ca = utils.get_openstack_ca()
+        encoded_openstack_ca = base64.b64encode(plain_openstack_ca)
+        extra_params['openstack_ca_coreos'] = encoded_openstack_ca
+
         return super(CoreOSK8sTemplateDefinition,
                      self).get_params(context, cluster_template, cluster,
                                       extra_params=extra_params,
diff --git a/magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/add-ext-ca-certs.yaml b/magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/add-ext-ca-certs.yaml
index 9cb8e30..059644c 100644
--- a/magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/add-ext-ca-certs.yaml
+++ b/magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/add-ext-ca-certs.yaml
@@ -15,6 +15,12 @@ write_files:
       [Install]
       WantedBy=multi-user.target
 
+  - path: /etc/ssl/certs/openstack-ca.pem
+    owner: "root:root"
+    permissions: "0644"
+    content: |
+      $OPENSTACK_CA
+
   - path: /etc/sysconfig/add-ext-ca-certs.sh
     owner: "root:root"
     permissions: "0755"
@@ -22,9 +28,8 @@ write_files:
       #!/bin/sh
 
       CERT_FILE=/etc/ssl/certs/openstack-ca.pem
-      if [ -n "$OPENSTACK_CA" ]
+      if [ -f "$CERT_FILE" ]
       then
-          echo -ne "$OPENSTACK_CA" | tee -a ${CERT_FILE}
 
           chmod 0644 ${CERT_FILE}
           chown root:root ${CERT_FILE}
diff --git a/magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/kubecluster.yaml b/magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/kubecluster.yaml
index 7d854f0..4e17cef 100644

 parameters:

+    type: string
+    default: true
+

     type: string
     description: name of ssh key to be provisioned on our server
@@ -377,6 +381,11 @@ parameters:
     hidden: true
     description: The OpenStack CA certificate to install on the node.
 
+  openstack_ca_coreos:
+    type: string
+    hidden: true

+

     type: string
     description: >
@@ -673,7 +682,7 @@ resources:

           dns_service_ip: {get_param: dns_service_ip}
           dns_cluster_domain: {get_param: dns_cluster_domain}
-          openstack_ca: {get_param: openstack_ca}
+          openstack_ca: {get_param: openstack_ca_coreos}
           nodes_server_group_id: {get_resource: nodes_server_group}
           availability_zone: {get_param: availability_zone}
           ca_key: {get_param: ca_key}
@@ -761,7 +770,7 @@ resources:

           dns_service_ip: {get_param: dns_service_ip}
           dns_cluster_domain: {get_param: dns_cluster_domain}

+          openstack_ca: {get_param: openstack_ca_coreos}
           nodes_server_group_id: {get_resource: nodes_server_group}
           availability_zone: {get_param: availability_zone}
           pods_network_cidr: {get_param: pods_network_cidr}

commit_message:
Migration Agent and CLI

Introduces a networking-ovn-migration-agent and a
networking-ovn-migration-cli used to orchestrate migration activities
from ML2/OVS to ML2/OVN where dataplane downtime exists since we
need to minimize such time as much as possible.

Co-Authored-By: Daniel Alvarez Sanchez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie478044e03063f6cf3d386ba4a873b62a011dba5

commit_message:
Using pod ready condition for pod readiness check

Using pod ready condition when pod readiness is requested and
container.ready when container readiness is requested

Change-Id: I300f09f57498465a681df01c2d5c3d979f12e4bf

commit_message:
add python 3.6 unit test job

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.6 as part of the python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I478e430848ba2d0f3736584866be4bd0aad82c45

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

commit_message:
Support file injection in CLI

Add support for file injection when creating/running a container.
An example is:

  $ zun run type=bind,source=<local_file>,destination=<path> nginx

If users specify the 'type' keyword as 'bind', zunclient will read
the file content from 'source' and send the content to server.

Implements: blueprint inject-files-to-container
Depends-On: I4ab6f50684f77bd7762e872d884ce11a7b0807ba
Change-Id: Ia8fc3b1e5ffa0511c64f7d68eb1c78d7916abb8a

subject: Performance: remove unnecessary workflow execution update
messages: [{'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-09-03 13:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-09-04 03:18:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-09-04 07:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-03 13:28:33.000000000', 'message': 'Performance: remove unnecessary workflow execution update

* This fix drastically improves performance since it eliminates
  an unnecessary update of the workflow execution object when
  processing "on_action_complete" operation. W/o this fix
  all such transactions would have to compete for the workflow
  executions table that causes lots of DB deadlocks (on MySQL)
  and transaction retries. In some cases the number of retries
  even exceeds the limit (currently hardcoded 50) and such tasks
  can be fixed only with the integrity checker over time.
  See the code comment in the "dispatcher.py" module that explains
  why this specific change eliminates the update of the workflow
  execution object.
* Style changes in api.py and aciton_execution_checker.py

Closes-Bug: #1790079

Change-Id: I08cb561e252d31e35fcfb61984d87a7bfc387a4d
(cherry picked from commit 8f40b01cb6bb01d81437aae795e7f34fcee66abb)
'}]
commit_message:
Performance: remove unnecessary workflow execution update

* This fix drastically improves performance since it eliminates
  an unnecessary update of the workflow execution object when
  processing "on_action_complete" operation. W/o this fix
  all such transactions would have to compete for the workflow
  executions table that causes lots of DB deadlocks (on MySQL)
  and transaction retries. In some cases the number of retries
  even exceeds the limit (currently hardcoded 50) and such tasks
  can be fixed only with the integrity checker over time.
  See the code comment in the "dispatcher.py" module that explains
  why this specific change eliminates the update of the workflow
  execution object.
* Style changes in api.py and aciton_execution_checker.py

Closes-Bug: #1790079

Change-Id: I08cb561e252d31e35fcfb61984d87a7bfc387a4d
(cherry picked from commit 8f40b01cb6bb01d81437aae795e7f34fcee66abb)

commit_message:
Gather facts for host healthcheck

If the facts for the hosts are stale, or not present,
the playbook fails unless facts are gathered from the
container hosts. They are required because the "Ensuring
containers creation, connection and good behavior" play
uses host vars from the hosts.

Change-Id: Id4daf24f10e61a1800d73093c2aa5b9724a1c615

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-03 11:57:10.000000000', 'message': "Fix issues with infrastructure healthcheck

1. If the load balancer host is not the same as the control
   plane hosts, then 'Ensuring haproxy runs' fails unless
   facts are gathered.

2. The value for 'repo_release_path' is set in the vars file
   'defaults/source_install.yml', so the repo check fails
   without reference to that vars file.

3. When running 'Sanity checks for all containers' not all
   host and container facts are gathered, so the play fails
   due to missing facts unless facts are set to gather.

4. Instead of verifying both localhost and the utility
   containers for being ready to run the os_* modules, we
   only need to verify whichever one is the designated
   'openstack_service_setup_host'.

5. The memcache server connectivity test should have a short
   timeout, otherwise the task hangs for ages if it isn't
   working.

6. The rabbitmq vhost name is corrected and set consistently,
   otherwise those tests do not work.

7. The rabbitmq test venv fails to build for two reasons. One
   is that the venv creation fails, because virtualenv tries
   to download the latest pip/setuptools and fails due to the
   pip.conf restricting it. The second is that the python
   package 'pika' is not on the repo server. The task is changed
   to make use of the common python_venv_build role and to make
   use of pypi as an index when building the wheel.

Change-Id: I6f5f4a1bd55abc78ad5993076719a3ac5914af1d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issues with infrastructure healthcheck

1. If the load balancer host is not the same as the control
   plane hosts, then 'Ensuring haproxy runs' fails unless
   facts are gathered.

2. The value for 'repo_release_path' is set in the vars file
   'defaults/source_install.yml', so the repo check fails
   without reference to that vars file.

3. When running 'Sanity checks for all containers' not all
   host and container facts are gathered, so the play fails
   due to missing facts unless facts are set to gather.

4. Instead of verifying both localhost and the utility
   containers for being ready to run the os_* modules, we
   only need to verify whichever one is the designated
   'openstack_service_setup_host'.

5. The memcache server connectivity test should have a short
   timeout, otherwise the task hangs for ages if it isn't
   working.

6. The rabbitmq vhost name is corrected and set consistently,
   otherwise those tests do not work.

7. The rabbitmq test venv fails to build for two reasons. One
   is that the venv creation fails, because virtualenv tries
   to download the latest pip/setuptools and fails due to the
   pip.conf restricting it. The second is that the python
   package 'pika' is not on the repo server. The task is changed
   to make use of the common python_venv_build role and to make
   use of pypi as an index when building the wheel.

Change-Id: I6f5f4a1bd55abc78ad5993076719a3ac5914af1d

commit_message:
Allow configuration of DB drivers on docker install

Added the ability to supply 'pubsub_driver' and 'nb_db_driver'
parameters to the docker deployment.
This allows installation with databases different than etcd.
The default driver is still the etcd one, to maintain backward
compatibility.

Related-Bug: #1778007
Change-Id: Ibbd3b0fc4116dd5ac6514730773f771c0b27e5f7

commit_message:
Move dragonflow job to experimental

The dragonflow job seems to be constantly failing and nobody is working
on fixing that, so let's move it to experimental to conserve some infra
resources.

Change-Id: I041072bae1c0212c9100ab7d2e44e543c224454f

commit_message:
Remove invalid options when deleting Kafka topics

With Apache Kafka 1.0.1 deleting topics fails if called with not
relevant options like `--partitions` or `--replication-factor`.

Change-Id: I614962f45e8487b34507ef1d695f3f76d0186d55
Story: 2002850
Task: 22799

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-30 13:17:04.000000000', 'message': "Remove unused config file when start ovs agent

ml2_conf.ini shoudn't be used in neutron-ovs-agent
Some parameters can be in conflict and overwrite
each other eg firewall_driver. Using openvswitch_agent
is enought to configure correct agent.

Change-Id: I815cb67fd4ea9ad98347d6d6bbcc9bcf01113649
Closes-Bug: 1789549
(cherry picked from commit 5c4983fd2458bbdbf05e82730f91b66c8b2737a1)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused config file when start ovs agent

ml2_conf.ini shoudn't be used in neutron-ovs-agent
Some parameters can be in conflict and overwrite
each other eg firewall_driver. Using openvswitch_agent
is enought to configure correct agent.

Change-Id: I815cb67fd4ea9ad98347d6d6bbcc9bcf01113649
Closes-Bug: 1789549
(cherry picked from commit 5c4983fd2458bbdbf05e82730f91b66c8b2737a1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-15 11:25:35.000000000', 'message': 'nlbaas2octavia: Escape 'key' field calls

The word "key" is reserved in SQL. lbaas_l7rules table has a field
name "key" which using it unescaped raises a mysql exception.

Change-Id: Ic0ddc86fe361014972f2a728beb3e8a3ed20e785
'}, {'created': '2018-08-30 08:24:06.000000000', 'message': 'nlbaas2octavia: Escape 'key' field calls

The word "key" is reserved in SQL. lbaas_l7rules table has a field
name "key" which using it unescaped raises a mysql exception.

Change-Id: Ic0ddc86fe361014972f2a728beb3e8a3ed20e785
'}]
commit_message:
nlbaas2octavia: Escape 'key' field calls

The word "key" is reserved in SQL. lbaas_l7rules table has a field
name "key" which using it unescaped raises a mysql exception.

Change-Id: Ic0ddc86fe361014972f2a728beb3e8a3ed20e785

This is not needed since'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-08-31 07:38:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

sphinx-build -a -E means [1]:

-a
If given, always write all output files. The default is to only write output files for new and changed source files. (This may not apply to all builders.)

-E
Don’t use a saved environment (the structure caching all cross-references), but rebuild it completely. The default is to only read and parse source files that are new or have changed since the last run.

[1] http://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/man/sphinx-build.html#cmdoption-sphinx-build-a'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-09-04 08:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I clean up this patch to avoid conflict with this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572955/ which is our priority now.'}]

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I3437bf0cb90af21e77b4d9f169c454db38ce77cb
Story: #2002586
Task: #24289

commit_message:
1. what is the problem?

   run “openstack multiregion networking pod list/create” return 401 anauthorized

2. What is the solution to the problem?

   fix the 401 error when using openstack multiregion cmd

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?

   no

Change-Id: I3a8f5796aba64e3edab4ea5f59df4fdf6fe13034
Signed-off-by:  zhangchi <zhangchi@szzt.com.cn>
Co-Authored-By: tangzhuo <ztang@hnu.edu.cn>

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints.txt from target branch

If TARGET_BRANCH is set to 'stable/xxx' other than master, it will
result in the following error:
fatal: Path 'upper-constraints.txt' does not exist in 'master'

Change-Id: Ia84ba7bd41e6b6bffc3da7d9577c40b10c4d89ee

commit_message:
Fix docker run script

Though this is not a problem in our case, the parameter parsing had a
bug in it.
when parsing the command line arguments, we did not "eat" the '--'
argument, thus if we were to run a script with the leftover arguments,
it would get that argument first and stop parsing.

Change-Id: Ia863e5cfc6a3fe6a31e32f034e282bda0534fd91

"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I132a11df0928800b72bc7a22e1be33fc321cce11

commit_message:
Removed constraint on floating ips as it might be created by heat

The constraints on neutron.network on OS::Neutron::FloatingIP
prevents a user from managning floating IPs from a heat stack
because at validation time, the networks that will be created
later on doesn't exist yet.

Change-Id: Idec332b1d7af3ed3f4f7530613b5cfac199bd51b
Closes-bug: 1768391

[{'account_id': 27518, 'date': '2018-08-24 07:32:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27518, 'date': '2018-08-25 02:01:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28646, 'date': '2018-08-27 08:00:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks for the contribution. 
However, if you make such changes, it would be great to see a clear motivation for them. 
I see it closes a bug, but the bug doesn't explain what is the reason for the change."}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2018-08-28 10:03:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Thank you for contributing. However, in my opinion we should not show this information to a regular user.

Only the administrator should have the authority to update a set of active datastore versions and upload new images. Therefore, information such as an image ID or whether a given version is active should not be relevant to a regular user. The regular user will always be presented with a filtered list of active versions that they can use to create instances.

The restriction has been introduced explicitelly[1]. I don't see enough reason to revert it.

Take AWS RDS service as an example. Service administrators manage a set of available datastore versions. The user can view only the available versions, but does not have access to the details.

The proposal of your change highlighted another problem. Datastore API has a few gaps in tenant authorization policy, and in several places tenant authorization is skipped.

The main problem concerns updating the datastores. "trove-manage" command, which is used for this purpose, instead of hitting the controller's endpoint that would perform the authorization according to the policy, operates directly on the database model. Moreover, such endpoint does not exist and the datastore API is completely unrestricted[2].

There may be a reason why it has been implemented in that way, but it is definitely worth verifying and discussing.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/63844/6//COMMIT_MSG
[2] https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/common/policies/datastores.py'}, {'account_id': 27518, 'date': '2018-09-04 07:21:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Bartosz Zurkowski
Thank your suggest very much.
Will you join PTG this time?
Our company's engineers can talk to you about trove."}]

commit_message:
Let member user show active and image-id

At present, only admin users can see both active and image-id
attributes, Now let member users can
also see these two attributes.

Change-Id: I17886a73d48a3349d89946ad158d4cd3306a3add
Closes-Bug: #1788795

There are no real limitations, the issue is based on the difficulty we
have with our code base to make it evolve.

Since we know that rx/tx queue size is supported for devices that are
build with virtio and using backend vhost or vhostuser (not sure about
qemu). In context of Nova that means any VIF_TYPE that are using
VIF_MODEL_VIRTIO.

I don't think we should try to figure out which VIF_TYPE is supported
that because for several VIF_TYPE we use the same path of code so we
are going to make our code even less readable.

Based on [0] We could fix that issue with a condition here [1] like:

  if model != network_model.VIF_MODEL_VIRTIO:
     driver = None

I know it's not the best, but we are limiting the impact. And based on
[3] only queues related things are going to be not set.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-23 11:33:13.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: set vfio driver in interface hostdev

It seem that if driver name is None nova try to set
rx_queue_size tx_queue_size config. (they define the
virtio-net rx/tx queue sizes). Direct port (SR-IOV)
is not vritio so this kind of config is invalid
and causing booting SR-IOV guest to failed. To avoid
this we set the driver name to be vfio in the libvirt
xml.

Change-Id: I45532896690ad9505f2b09c98d8d86b61bcfef2b
'}, {'created': '2018-08-26 07:14:19.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: skip setting rx/tx queue sizes for not virto interfaces

It seem that if driver name is None nova try to set
rx_queue_size tx_queue_size config. (they define the
virtio-net rx/tx queue sizes). Direct/Physical Direct
vnic_types are not vritio so this kind of config is
invalid and causing booting guest to failed. To avoid
we skip such configuration to these vnic_types

Closes-Bug: #1789074

Change-Id: I45532896690ad9505f2b09c98d8d86b61bcfef2b
'}, {'created': '2018-08-28 09:24:07.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: skip setting rx/tx queue sizes for not virto interfaces

It seem that if driver name is None nova try to set
rx_queue_size tx_queue_size config. (they define the
virtio-net rx/tx queue sizes). Direct/Physical Direct
vnic_types are not vritio so this kind of config is
invalid and causing booting guest to failed. To avoid
issues we skip such configuration these  vnic_types

Closes-Bug: #1789074

Change-Id: I45532896690ad9505f2b09c98d8d86b61bcfef2b
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: skip setting rx/tx queue sizes for not virto interfaces

It seem that if driver name is None nova try to set
rx_queue_size tx_queue_size config. (they define the
virtio-net rx/tx queue sizes). Direct/Physical Direct
vnic_types are not vritio so this kind of config is
invalid and causing booting guest to failed. To avoid
issues we skip such configuration these  vnic_types

Closes-Bug: #1789074

Change-Id: I45532896690ad9505f2b09c98d8d86b61bcfef2b

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints.txt from target branch

If TARGET_BRANCH is set to 'stable/xxx' other than master, it will
result in the following error:
fatal: Path 'upper-constraints.txt' does not exist in 'master'

Change-Id: Ia84ba7bd41e6b6bffc3da7d9577c40b10c4d89ee

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-31 08:17:31.000000000', 'message': 'Do not set microversion for server diagnostics negative test

After microversion 2.48, response data from each hypervisor
differs from that before 2.48, so microversion is set in
test_server_diagnostics.py, but for server diagnostics negative
test("Non-admin user cannot view server diagnostic"), there
is no difference between before and after 2.48, so no need to
set microversion for server diagnostics negative test.

Change-Id: I0c256aa58258de934fd6e49cc5e1ef6b8ab1abd6
'}]
commit_message:
Do not set microversion for server diagnostics negative test

After microversion 2.48, response data from each hypervisor
differs from that before 2.48, so microversion is set in
test_server_diagnostics.py, but for server diagnostics negative
test("Non-admin user cannot view server diagnostic"), there
is no difference between before and after 2.48, so no need to
set microversion for server diagnostics negative test.

Change-Id: I0c256aa58258de934fd6e49cc5e1ef6b8ab1abd6

subject: Update zuul packaging for zuul 2.1.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 16272, 'date': '2015-05-26 21:50:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-05-26 21:50:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/52/185752/1/check/noop/969da7a/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2015-05-27 15:52:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Nice! Going to try and merge some patches before this.  But looks good. Need to download and still build'}, {'account_id': 7069, 'date': '2015-06-01 14:26:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Zuul 2.0 split out part of its functionality into a new binary zuul-merger (for scalability).

I'm guessing this should probably be written into the package or distributed as a different package.

http://docs.openstack.org/infra/zuul/merger.html"}, {'account_id': 16272, 'date': '2015-06-04 16:58:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-06-04 16:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/52/185752/2/check/noop/334c09c/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2015-06-04 18:41:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I wonder if we should just ask -infra for a new zuul release. Since 2.0.0 is a little dated right now.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 16272, 'date': '2015-06-04 21:36:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-06-04 21:36:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/52/185752/3/check/noop/5b32833/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 7069, 'date': '2015-06-16 11:06:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Did you have any thoughts about packaging the zuul-merger or did I miss it?'}, {'account_id': 16272, 'date': '2015-06-16 12:24:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm not sure what advantage a separate zuul-merger .deb would bring; do you have a case in mind?"}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2015-06-16 14:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

To be honest, I think the break out could happen in the next patchset.  But, ya, it would allow you to run it on a separate host.'}, {'account_id': 16272, 'date': '2015-06-16 23:57:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16272, 'date': '2015-06-16 23:59:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Is the objective of the split just to deal with initscripts, since otherwise the files that would be split out are single python scripts?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-06-17 00:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/52/185752/4/check/noop/a9c6052/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 7069, 'date': '2015-06-17 03:38:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

It doesn't need to be a separate deb, but zuul won't work without the merger daemon. I can't see anywhere in the repo where the merger is installed. Am I missing something?"}, {'account_id': 16272, 'date': '2015-06-17 03:48:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

Ah, yes.  That's taken care of by the setup.cfg (console_scripts) of zuul.

% dpkg-deb -c /var/cache/pbuilder/result/zuul_2.1.0-1_all.deb | grep bin
drwxr-xr-x root/root         0 2015-06-16 19:52 ./usr/bin/
-rwxr-xr-x root/root       154 2015-06-16 19:52 ./usr/bin/zuul-server
-rwxr-xr-x root/root       154 2015-06-16 19:52 ./usr/bin/zuul
-rwxr-xr-x root/root       154 2015-06-16 19:52 ./usr/bin/zuul-merger
-rwxr-xr-x root/root       154 2015-06-16 19:52 ./usr/bin/zuul-cloner"}, {'account_id': 16272, 'date': '2015-06-17 04:08:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-06-17 04:08:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/52/185752/5/check/noop/7aa6cfa/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 16272, 'date': '2015-06-17 04:12:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I now think that a followup patch should split into at least 3 binary packages.'}, {'account_id': 7069, 'date': '2015-06-18 11:41:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Ah okay, that's cool. I don't know enough deb packaging to +2 sorry, but it lgtm."}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2015-06-19 15:58:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Could you make the build system chance a separate patch set? To be honest, I've not used it yet and would be reluctant to switch atm.

I don't know enough about it to +1"}, {'account_id': 16272, 'date': '2015-06-19 21:11:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

So three separate patches: version 2.1.0, pybuild, and split .debs?  Or the last two in one?'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2015-06-23 14:25:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

For me, pybuild would be the last patchset, since I'm not familar with it.  Not saying that is a reason to stop using it, but some research is needed.

This current patchset is nuking files related to gbp too.

Either way, I think bumping to 2.1.0 is needed, then breaking out cloner.  Converting to another build system, seems low priority to me.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 16272, 'date': '2015-06-26 19:55:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-06-26 19:55:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/52/185752/6/check/noop/4398e26/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 16272, 'date': '2015-06-26 19:57:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

We can discuss the changes moved to I215eec8cdac94597ed4b40694e669c7feb50dcf9 on that one now.'}, {'account_id': 7069, 'date': '2015-06-28 06:32:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-09-04 05:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Per thread [1] this project has been retired.  See [2] 

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-infra/2018-August/006058.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/597531'}]

commit_message:
Update zuul packaging for zuul 2.1.0

This updates build dependencies and tweaks packaging so that
a zuul 2.1.0 package can be built.

At this time it is necessary to invoke sphinx without -W because
the two program-output directives in doc/source/client.rst cannot
succeed.

At present no initscript is shipped for zuul-merger.

Change-Id: I7b3cbf1fdfdad051633b4c32c86bfa5c8ab9b5df

commit_message:
Import the legacy grenade sahara job

While it would have been better to directly use a native Zuul v3 job,
the work towards a common grenade job seems to be stalled.
Import the job locally and fix some issues:
- make sure that the heat_tempest_plugin is loaded correctly,
  so that the heat upgrade tests work;
- bump the starting point from stable/ocata (!) to stable/queens;
  it will be changed to stable/rocky when grenade supports it;
  will require additional fixes due to the standalone->uwsgi change.
- import lib/apache so that wsgi deployment works.

Story: 2001686
Task: 24517
Change-Id: Ia8de2b8286287355e8e9d3f702027aa282ed8282

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I5c06bc35d0ff9e68743b1d44cbba2541268b88ec
Story: #2002586
Task: #24314

oops'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-08-01 13:37:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

a) there's no evidence that a performance issue actually exists for this yet (the commit message just says "performance could be bad")

b) we've had attempts in the past to increase the size of the aggregate_metadata.value column and even change its column type to TEXT from VARCHAR(255). if there was an index on the value column, and the column type was TEXT, that would be pretty disastrous from a memory and performance perspective.

I'd just rather we do this if and only if we see a marked problem in this particular query in production systems.

-jay'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-08-02 02:17:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > a) there's no evidence that a performance issue actually exists for
 > this yet (the commit message just says "performance could be bad")
 > 
 > b) we've had attempts in the past to increase the size of the
 > aggregate_metadata.value column and even change its column type to
 > TEXT from VARCHAR(255). if there was an index on the value column,
 > and the column type was TEXT, that would be pretty disastrous from
 > a memory and performance perspective.
 > 
 > I'd just rather we do this if and only if we see a marked problem
 > in this particular query in production systems.
 > 
 > -jay

Thanks for the review, Hmm, I didn't thought about that, I was just learning the code and found out both "require_tenant_aggregate" and  "map_az_to_placement_aggregate" request filters are matching values, so I thought it might improve the performance in large scale deployement.'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-09-04 03:38:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-01 07:22:06.000000000', 'message': 'Expand aggregate_metadata table index to cover 'value' as well

The require_tenant_aggregate request filter was added in
Idb52b2a9af539df653da7a36763cb9a1d0de3d1b, it queries
hosts aggregates by its metadata, and since it is used
for matching spesific "filter_tenant_id:123" key and value
pairs. As the host aggregates table only has index
for metadata key, it is possible that with a large number

commit_message:
Expand aggregate_metadata table index to cover 'value' as well

The require_tenant_aggregate request filter was added in
Idb52b2a9af539df653da7a36763cb9a1d0de3d1b, it queries
hosts aggregates by its metadata, and since it is used
for matching spesific "filter_tenant_id:123" key and value
pairs. As the host aggregates table only has index
for metadata key, it is possible that with a large number
of tenants, the performance could be bad. We should also
add value to the index.

Change-Id: Ifc020015daff0d2e20d6f8b1069b028115d66b35
Closes-Bug: #1784769

Incorrect use of translation _()

Keystone uses translated strings both in
logging an exceptions. This is incorrect.
All strings that are passed to logging
should remain un-translated. This patch
addresses above issue.

Change-Id: Idf4f0bc1bd63eb8dc6dc61d8a49a9e2a93320474
Closes-Bug: #1777671

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I54ea3b656fe132d6e946e0e29a2cf9dab3d7a88c
Story: #2002586
Task: #24310

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 22:27:31.000000000', 'message': "update pylint to 1.9.2

The older version of pylint being used does not work correctly under
python 3. In order to be able to update the pylint job to run under
python 3, we need to update the tool.

This patch updates to the latest version at this time. It also updates
and pins astroid, which was previously capped. Using a pin instead of
a cap should let us avoid issues with new releases while being
specific about which version to actually use.

The import-error linter rule is disabled because it appears in
Windows-related code that looks for modules we don't expect to be able
to find on the CI system under Linux.

The non-iterator-returned rule is disabled because it is erroring on a
class that doesn't make sense (freezer.utils.utils.ReSizeStream does
appear to honor the iterator protocol). Further investigation is
probably warranted on this one.

The public entry point for multiprocessing.SimpleQueue is the
top-level multiprocessing module, not multiprocessing.queues. The
linter correctly caught this error because the ctx argument was not
being passed to the class. The fix is to use the top-level entry point
to access the class.

basestring is no longer defined under python 3. The fix is to use
six.string_types, which correctly sets the alias to str or
basestring. By using the library, we can avoid having to tell the
linter to ignore the local customization.

The linter also caught a base raise, without an exception specified
and not in the context of an exception handler. I added an exception
using the pattern from the one on an earlier line.

Change-Id: I349de35c9ee52e2946e661f777308444b61ba4e0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
update pylint to 1.9.2

The older version of pylint being used does not work correctly under
python 3. In order to be able to update the pylint job to run under
python 3, we need to update the tool.

This patch updates to the latest version at this time. It also updates
and pins astroid, which was previously capped. Using a pin instead of
a cap should let us avoid issues with new releases while being
specific about which version to actually use.

The import-error linter rule is disabled because it appears in
Windows-related code that looks for modules we don't expect to be able
to find on the CI system under Linux.

The non-iterator-returned rule is disabled because it is erroring on a
class that doesn't make sense (freezer.utils.utils.ReSizeStream does
appear to honor the iterator protocol). Further investigation is
probably warranted on this one.

The public entry point for multiprocessing.SimpleQueue is the
top-level multiprocessing module, not multiprocessing.queues. The
linter correctly caught this error because the ctx argument was not
being passed to the class. The fix is to use the top-level entry point
to access the class.

basestring is no longer defined under python 3. The fix is to use
six.string_types, which correctly sets the alias to str or
basestring. By using the library, we can avoid having to tell the
linter to ignore the local customization.

The linter also caught a base raise, without an exception specified
and not in the context of an exception handler. I added an exception
using the pattern from the one on an earlier line.

Change-Id: I349de35c9ee52e2946e661f777308444b61ba4e0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Hai <nguyentrihai93@gmail.com>

commit_message:
3PAR: Added retries on volume deletion

online copy can be completed so the condition
to find active task of online copy can be missed
and this results in deleteVolume failure

Added a retries to delete a volume

Change-Id: I902896d4127c219aeea62a4c0994c6d5bb9e82f3
Closes-Bug: #1783934

that contains non-English charaters. This commit fixes
it by using the RFC 3548 encodings are suitable for encoding
binary data so that it can safely included as part of an HTTP
request/response. The archive file data will be encoded before
sending over HTTP and decoded after.

API version to 1.25. API version in 1.24 or earlier won't
encode/decode the file data.

commit_message:
Encode/Decode archive file data

In before, API users were not able to get/put archive file
that contains non-English charaters. This commit fixes
it by using the RFC 3548 encodings are suitable for encoding
binary data so that it can safely included as part of an HTTP
request/response. The archive file data will be encoded before
sending over HTTP and decoded after.

To maintain backward-compatibility, this commit also bumps the
API version to 1.25. API version in 1.24 or earlier won't
encode/decode the file data.

Needed-By: Id9fe25e06052d46dcc33a1e05100ef7a2d7db018
Change-Id: I1a2a9bada2f88d511b20fe586b9fa46b3a0289d6
Closes-Bug: #1789777

subject: Port items from instack-undercloud
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-27 16:13:29.000000000', 'message': 'Port items from instack-undercloud

Currently we leverage the overcloud-full and pip-and-virtualenv-override
elements from instack-undercloud during image building. In order to
remove instack-undercloud as a dependency, we need to move these items
elsewhere.  Since you cannot have overlapping names, the overcloud-full
element functionality has been moved to overcloud-base with the file
names 50 being replaced with 51.  The pip-and-virtualenv-override
elements has been renamed to override-pip-and-virtualenv.  A subsequent
set of patches will be posted to tripleo-common to remove
instack-undercloud from the image building path and an update to the
elements required when building images.

commit_message:
Port items from instack-undercloud

Currently we leverage the overcloud-full and pip-and-virtualenv-override
elements from instack-undercloud during image building. In order to
remove instack-undercloud as a dependency, we need to move these items
elsewhere.  Since you cannot have overlapping names, the overcloud-full
element functionality has been moved to overcloud-base and
overcloud-compute with the file names 50 being replaced with 51.
The pip-and-virtualenv-override elements has been renamed to
override-pip-and-virtualenv.  A subsequent set of patches will be posted
to tripleo-common to remove instack-undercloud from the image building
path and an update to the elements required when building images.

Change-Id: I1de0b6421ef455ef58c0146da7fe52c35682b395
Related-Blueprint: remove-instack-undercloud

Partial-Bug: #1790109
'}]
commit_message:
Handle VirtualBMC 1.4.0+ setup

VirtualBMC 1.4.0+ RPM includes systemd unit file.

Make use of systemd unit file if we are running Rocky+
(implies VirtualBMC 1.4.0+) or keep old way of VirtualBMC
deployment otherwise.

Because of the differences in the shipped systemd unit file
versus the one that this playbook has been creating at
run time, we need an extra recipe to start VirtualBMC 1.4.0+
instances.

Change-Id: I047ce7d545a3dcbc3508d017d360b9c03fa895b9
Partial-Bug: #1790109

commit_message:
Add Ironic inspector health checks

This patch add health checks for ironic_inspector container
and ironic_inspector_dnsmasq container. Inspector health is checked
using curl of the API interface and dnsmasq is checked using opened
port verification.

Change-Id: I0bcc713d342f6388750dd9dcecf439db3c59d651

Can I copy this file somewhere in a live container to quickly test it, without the need for a full redeployment?'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2018-04-30 09:51:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2018-04-30 13:50:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hey Luigi, yes you can just copy this to container, just check if you have /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-common/healthcheck/common.sh. If not then just copy it from here: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/master/healthcheck/common.sh'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-06-22 14:58:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

After copying the script in the proper place inside the container I tried to execute it, and the healthcheck_port function fails. Namely this section:

ss -ntp | awk '{print $5,"-",$6}'

does not contain sahara-api in the output. The similar script sahara-engine in the sahara-engine container works as expected.
Maybe it's a glitch and it would work when the script is properly built in the container, but I wanted to raise it.

Please note that I tested it on a Queens container, so this may affect the result too.'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2018-07-02 08:18:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-02 08:58:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

It returns something now :)'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-07-02 11:26:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-07-03 13:09:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-03 13:27:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-08-18 15:29:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

It looks like WSGI support landed in puppet just in time for Rocky:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-sahara

but this may require further work on tripleo to enable it.

(and generally, ping about this change)'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2018-08-24 10:03:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2018-08-24 10:04:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Add health check script for Sahara API

Adds health checks script for Sahara API using curl.

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is maintained
project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I2a93012230ce0ec0b0c23859d156a46349a1cde6

tagged as an issue. This changes the hashing of logs to SHA256
instead of SHA1.

(cherry picked from commit ccf6cb79033b2083d9177823094f7836eb68ae0d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-31 14:07:19.000000000', 'message': 'Simplify inserting apt keys into nspawn image

Bionic requires a functioning gpg-agent to run apt-key add. This means
that gpg-agent must be working properly in the chroot when the nspawn
image preparation script runs.

Previous changes [1] have enabled apt-key to communicate with gpg-agent
during the nspawn_hosts role checks, however the cache prep fails almost
every time when nspawn_hosts is used within other role checks.

This is not a new issue, debian-installer is affected too [2].

This change adopts the same route as d-i, and simply copies the host
/etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d directory to the nspawn image, removing the
need for apt-key and in turn gpg-agent.

This is a re-implementation of https://review.openstack.org/588962
for nspawn.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/590431
[2] https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=851774

Change-Id: I3c56da445377d7ba27a623fb7ebe95c20d28a327
(cherry picked from commit f3fe9497119e372cf9f92516c6bd99e518318a51)
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify inserting apt keys into nspawn image

Bionic requires a functioning gpg-agent to run apt-key add. This means
that gpg-agent must be working properly in the chroot when the nspawn
image preparation script runs.

Previous changes [1] have enabled apt-key to communicate with gpg-agent
during the nspawn_hosts role checks, however the cache prep fails almost
every time when nspawn_hosts is used within other role checks.

This is not a new issue, debian-installer is affected too [2].

This change adopts the same route as d-i, and simply copies the host
/etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d directory to the nspawn image, removing the
need for apt-key and in turn gpg-agent.

This is a re-implementation of https://review.openstack.org/588962
for nspawn.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/590431
[2] https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=851774

Change-Id: I3c56da445377d7ba27a623fb7ebe95c20d28a327
(cherry picked from commit f3fe9497119e372cf9f92516c6bd99e518318a51)

commit_message:
Fix devstack/lib/ovs to run with Fedora 28

The patch is fixing two problems found when stacking DevStack on a
Fedora 28 host OS.

Problem 1: Account to the different patch versions between the
kernel-devel and kernel-headers packages.

Problem 2: Install the elfutils-libelf-devel package which is needed to
compile OVS.

For more a detailed information about each problem, check the bug linked
in this patch.

Closes-Bug: #1790143
Change-Id: Idfdee28124ff19272abcaaa3adade0435e3e474a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 21:31:48.000000000', 'message': 'Use a common python build/install role for source-base deployment

Instead of copying a common set of code between all the roles,
switch to using a common role which checks whether a deploy host
already has the appropriate venv package. If it does not, build
it on the fly and pull it to the deploy host.

Implementing this does away with the requirement to do builds
on the repo container. Once this has been implemented into all
roles then the repo_build role will be retired.

Change-Id: Ib822c0a9c9a06d4505a898c48f1126974c643f2b
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
'}, {'created': '2018-09-01 19:40:16.000000000', 'message': "Use a common python build/install role

In order to radically simplify how we prepare the service
venvs, we use a common role to do the wheel builds and the
venv preparation. This makes the process far simpler to
understand, because the role does its own building and
installing. It also reduces the code maintenance burden,
because instead of duplicating the build processes in the
repo_build role and the service role - we only have it all
done in a single place.

We also change the role venv tag var to use the integrated
build's common venv tag so that we can remove the role's
venv tag in group_vars in the integrated build. This reduces
memory consumption and also reduces the duplication.

This is by no means the final stop in the simplification
process, but it is a step forward. The will be work to follow
which:

1. Replaces 'developer mode' with an equivalent mechanism
   that uses the common role and is simpler to understand.
   We will also simplify the provisioning of pip install
   arguments when doing this.
2. Simplifies the installation of optional pip packages.
   Right now it's more complicated than it needs to be due
   to us needing to keep the py_pkgs plugin working in the
   integrated build.
3. Deduplicates the distro package installs. Right now the
   role installs the distro packages twice - just before
   building the venv, and during the python_venv_build role
   execution.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/598957
Change-Id: Ib822c0a9c9a06d4505a898c48f1126974c643f2b
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
"}, {'created': '2018-09-01 20:32:15.000000000', 'message': "Use a common python build/install role

In order to radically simplify how we prepare the service
venvs, we use a common role to do the wheel builds and the
venv preparation. This makes the process far simpler to
understand, because the role does its own building and
installing. It also reduces the code maintenance burden,
because instead of duplicating the build processes in the
repo_build role and the service role - we only have it all
done in a single place.

We also change the role venv tag var to use the integrated
build's common venv tag so that we can remove the role's
venv tag in group_vars in the integrated build. This reduces
memory consumption and also reduces the duplication.

This is by no means the final stop in the simplification
process, but it is a step forward. The will be work to follow
which:

1. Replaces 'developer mode' with an equivalent mechanism
   that uses the common role and is simpler to understand.
   We will also simplify the provisioning of pip install
   arguments when doing this.
2. Simplifies the installation of optional pip packages.
   Right now it's more complicated than it needs to be due
   to us needing to keep the py_pkgs plugin working in the
   integrated build.
3. Deduplicates the distro package installs. Right now the
   role installs the distro packages twice - just before
   building the venv, and during the python_venv_build role
   execution.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/598957
Change-Id: Ib822c0a9c9a06d4505a898c48f1126974c643f2b
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Use a common python build/install role

In order to radically simplify how we prepare the service
venvs, we use a common role to do the wheel builds and the
venv preparation. This makes the process far simpler to
understand, because the role does its own building and
installing. It also reduces the code maintenance burden,
because instead of duplicating the build processes in the
repo_build role and the service role - we only have it all
done in a single place.

We also change the role venv tag var to use the integrated
build's common venv tag so that we can remove the role's
venv tag in group_vars in the integrated build. This reduces
memory consumption and also reduces the duplication.

This is by no means the final stop in the simplification
process, but it is a step forward. The will be work to follow
which:

1. Replaces 'developer mode' with an equivalent mechanism
   that uses the common role and is simpler to understand.
   We will also simplify the provisioning of pip install
   arguments when doing this.
2. Simplifies the installation of optional pip packages.
   Right now it's more complicated than it needs to be due
   to us needing to keep the py_pkgs plugin working in the
   integrated build.
3. Deduplicates the distro package installs. Right now the
   role installs the distro packages twice - just before
   building the venv, and during the python_venv_build role
   execution.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/598957
Change-Id: Ib822c0a9c9a06d4505a898c48f1126974c643f2b
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ia662dde401dc20957d7ddc47354739c141336500

commit_message:
Change log hashing to SHA256

With the recent Bandit update[0], the usage of SHA1 is now being
tagged as an issue. This changes the hashing of logs to SHA256
instead of SHA1.

[0] https://pypi.org/project/bandit/1.5.0/

Change-Id: Icde62b8d5ff78b4155e9df8231d63be3ecc53520
(cherry picked from commit ccf6cb79033b2083d9177823094f7836eb68ae0d)
